00040 #define generic void *   /* -- type for objects from generic packages -- */
00041 
00042 #define info_t  void    /* -- info type to use with generic structures -- */
00043 
00044 typedef int counter;                /* -- counter and index for arrays -- */
00045 
00046 typedef float distance_t;               /* -- distance between regions -- */
00047 
00048 typedef char key_t[KEYLEN + 1];     /* -- keyword for store with index -- */

00051 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00052             -- QUEUE STRUCTURES --
00053 -------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 
00055 struct st_queue {
00056     counter q_spos;                 /* start position   */
00057     counter q_rpos;                 /* rear position    */
00058     counter q_size;                 /* queue size       */
00059     info_t  **queue;                /* the actual queue */
00060     };
00061 
00062 typedef struct st_queue *queue_t;   /* -- fixed-length circular queue -- */
00063 
00064 typedef struct q_node {
00065     info_t          *item;          /* pointer to data stored in the node   */
00066     struct q_node   *next;          /* pointer to next node in the queue    */
00067     } q_node_t;             /* -- node of a dynamic queue -- */
00068 
00069 typedef struct {
00070     int         q_size;             /* size of the queue    */
00071     q_node_t    *q_front;           /* front element        */
00072     q_node_t    *q_rear;            /* last (growing) end   */
00073     } *fifo_t;              /* -- dynamic queue -- */
00074

00076 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00077             -- LIST STRUCTURES --
00078 -------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079                                      
00080 struct l_node {
00081     info_t          *item;          /* info record stored in the node */
00082     struct l_node   *next;          /* link to next node in the list  */
00083     };
00084 
00085 typedef struct l_node l_node_t; /* -- single linked list node -- */
00086 
00087 struct l_head {
00088     int         l_length;           /* number of nodes in the list    */
00089     l_node_t    *l_first;           /* link to first node in the list */
00090     l_node_t    *l_last;            /* link to last node              */
00091     };
00092 
00093 typedef struct l_head l_head_t; /* -- single linked list header info -- */
00094 typedef l_head_t *list_t;       /* -- singly linked list             -- */
00095 
00096 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------
00097             -- DOUBLY LINKED LIST STRUCTURES --
00098 --------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00099 
00100 struct dbly_node {                  /* structure of a 2-linked node     */
00101     info_t          *item;          /* pointer to record stored in it   */
00102     struct dbl_node *prev;          /* pointer to previous node         */
00103     struct dbl_node *next;          /* pointer to successor node        */
00104     };
00105 
00106 typedef struct dbly_node dl_node_t; /* -- doubly linked list node    -- */
00107 
00108 typedef struct {
00109     int         dl_length;          /* number of nodes in the list      */
00110     dl_node_t   *dl_first;          /* pointer to the list's first node */
00111     dl_node_t   *dl_last;           /* pointer to the list's last node  */
00112     } dl_head_t;                /* -- doubly linked list header info -- */
00113 typedef dl_head_t *dlist_t;     /* -- doubly linked list             -- */
00114

00119 typedef struct s_node {
00120     info_t          *item;          /* information stored in this node  */
00121     struct s_node   *next;          /* underlying node in the stack     */
00122     }   s_node_t;           /* -- node in the stack                  -- */
00123 
00124 typedef struct {
00125     int         s_length;           /* size of the stack                */
00126     s_node_t    *s_top;             /* upper item stored in the stack   */
00127     } *lifo_t;              /* -- stack (LIFO) header information    -- */

00133 
00134 typedef struct {
00135     long    i_pos;                      /* item position in DB      */
00136     key_t   i_key;                      /* keyword for item         */
00137     } index_t;          /* -- a simple index into database       -- */
00138 
00139 typedef struct {
00140     counter     r_begin;                /* position of first aa     */
00141     counter     r_length;               /* length of the region     */
00142     counter     r_offset;               /* offset to first region   */
00143     flag        r_status;               /* used in backtracking     */
00144     } region_t;         /* -- region characteristics             -- */
00145 
00146 typedef struct {
00147     index_t     p_index;                /* index into prot. library */
00148     char        p_name[PNAME_LEN + 1];  /* name of this protein     */
00149     char        p_seq[MAX_SEQ_LEN + 1]; /* aminoacid sequence       */
00150     int         p_seqlen;               /* sequence length          */
00151     int         p_nofeats;              /* no of features measured  */
00152     float       **p_aaval;              /* values by feature / aa   */
00153     list_t      *p_regions;     /* lists of significative regions   */
00154     } protein_t;        /* -- basic protein characteristics      -- */
00155

00158             -- DESCRIPTOR STRUCTURES --
00159 -------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00160 
00161 
00162 typedef float feature_table_t[AA_NUMBER];       /* -- ça  même -- */
00163 
00164 typedef struct {
00165     string          f_name;         /* feature name                 */
00166     feature_table_t f_values;       /* values for every aa          */
00167     float           f_maxvalue;     /* max. amd min. values in the  */
00168     float           f_minvalue;     /* table (used after normaliz.) */
00169     flag            f_inverted;     /* invert values.               */
00170     int             f_window;       /* window size to apply         */
00171     float           f_threshold;    /* threshold to define a region */
00172     int             f_minrglen;     /* minimum region length        */
00173     int             f_maxrglen;     /* maximum region length        */
00174     int             f_no_regions;   /* minimum number of regions    */
00175     float           f_moment;       /* moment angle in degrees      */
00176     } feature_t;
00177 
00178 typedef struct {
00179     string      d_name;             /* name of descriptor           */
00180     int         d_minplen;          /* minimum protein length       */
00181     l_head_t    *d_features;        /* the features                 */
00182     l_head_t    *d_rules;           /* the rules                    */
00183     region_t    ***d_regions;       /* map of regions to cover      */
00184     int         d_maxregno;         /* maximum number of regions    */
00185     } descriptor_t;     /* -- descriptor to check                -- */
00186 
00187 /* The rule will be one of the following: */
00188 
00189 /* Rule # 1: Physical separation between two regions    */
00190 /*  dist (F1, R1, p1) - (F2, R2, p2) = <min .. max>     */
00191 typedef struct {
00192         /* position in the first region */
00193         int feat1;
00194         int reg1;
00195         int pos1;
00196         /* position in the second region */
00197         int feat2;
00198         int reg2;
00199         int pos2;
00200         /* allowed distance limits */
00201         int dmin;
00202         int dmax;
00203 } distance_rule_t;
00204 
00205 /* Rule # 2: Is there a given aminoacid sequence    */
00206 /* beginning at a specific position ?               */
00207 /*      Seq "sq" in (P1, R1, min .. max)            */
00208 typedef struct {
00209         string  sr_seq;
00210         int sr_feat;
00211         int sr_reg;
00212         int sr_minpos;
00213         int sr_maxpos;
00214 } sequence_rule_t;
00215 
00216 /* Rule # 3: How similar is its profile to the pattern region ? */
00217 /*      Prof (P, R) (values,,,) < min                           */
00218 typedef struct {
00219         int     pr_feat;
00220         int     pr_reg;
00221         int     pr_len;
00222         float   *pr_values;
00223         float   pr_mindiff;
00224 } profile_rule_t;
00225 
00226 typedef struct {
00227     int     type;                           /* type of rule */
00228     flag    status;                         /* status (visited or not) */
00229     union {
00230         distance_rule_t     distance_rule;
00231         sequence_rule_t     sequence_rule;
00232         profile_rule_t      profile_rule;
00233     } data;                                 /* The actual rule */
00234 }   rule_t;             /* -- General rule type for evaluation -- */
00235 
00236 
00237 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------
00238             -- RULE PARSER STRUCTURES --
00239 -------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00240 
00241 
00242 typedef struct {
00243         flag    tk_type;            /* type of token */
00244         char    *tk_data;           /* data of the token */
00245     } token_t;          /* -- token used by the parser -- */
